content.description: Huge, clean looking corner with a rather weird hand crack in the middle. A little painful but different, interesting, and fun. Can be started directly via a slightly scary huge flake or a two move finger crack. Alternately, climb the blocks to the right of the crack and start from a ledge.
content.location: Just to the right of Holy Grail.

content.description: Dive into the slot, squirm to the roof, exit right, tomahawk for the sky.
content.location: Tight V slot, almost at the head of Capulet.

content.description: Really fun fingers to a cool hard sequence.
content.protection: Finger size gear. The crux can be protected with a bomber small nut just around the roof and another bomber medium-small nut at the finger lock just past the crux. A #2 link cam nicely protects the anchor clip.
content.location: Behind the oak tree in the Rocky Alcove. The Rocky Alcove is the first feature in Capulet.

content.description: Fists to fingers to same anchor as Mercutio. The first ten feet is a bit gritty but the rock is OK.
content.location: Left side of Grassy Alcove, shares anchor with Mercutio.

content.description: Fingers to overhanging thin hands up twin cracks.
content.location: The Rocky Alcove is the first feature in Capulet. This is the obvious twin crack splitter on the left side of the alcove.

content.description: Awkward and a little dirty. Thin hands to akes to a ledge, wide hands to the anchor.
content.location: See overview photo. Three quarters of the way towards the head of Capulet.

content.description: Hands to fingers to thin hands under a roof. Shares anchor with Castor.
content.location: The right crack on the short blank face; goes up to the small roof with a tree on top. Anchor is under the roof.

content.description: Left (wide) crack of the two main cracks that share this face. Shares anchor with crack to right.
content.location: Right wall of the Grassy Alcove.

content.description: Thin hands to fat fingers to right trending traverse. Full value! Would be 4 (and 5.12) stars if it was longer.
content.location: This is in the small grassy alcove half way up Capulet; it's set up off the floor of the canyon by about 10 feet.

content.description:
The top half of this route is amazing, but the bottom is both easy and only ok. There are two main cracks about the fifteen feet right of Anklebiter. The left of the cracks is offwidth and heads up towards the obvious finger crack on the upper face. It's got quite a bit of dirt in it and is not the recommended start, even though it's direct. The right crack heads straight up to the big chimney. It's clean and about 5.7 and is the best way to get to the finger crack. It terminates on a pillar just below the chimney. Climb the 5.7, slinging any pieces long so that the rope runs outside of the crack. From the top of the pillar, reach left and place an 0.5 Alien in the finger crack on the face--a #5 will protect this move.  Step left into the pod at the start of the fingers and then pull! 

  The fingers to the thin hands above is well worth the shenanigans required to get to the finger crack above. It protects well and is super fun locker fingers with very minimal feet.
content.protection: 3 each #0.4-0.5, 2 each #1, 1 each #2. Maybe take a 3 and a 5 for the bottom half of the route.
content.location: About fifteen feet right of Anklebiter. Look for the crack that splits the face and then wraps right into the chimney.

content.description: Everyones favorite Capulet. LB (or thin hands for a 13 year old girl) up a shallow corner to a small roof. Nice stance 15 feet up on the arete.
content.protection: (3) #0.5-1. Set TCUs (green Alien size for the roof).  Possible to place a #2 in the pod.
content.location: The clean looking corner two cracks to the left of the unmistakable Holy Grail roof crack.

content.description: Are you Galahad enough? Fingers to thin hands to a ten foot roof. Unmistakeable.
content.protection: 1-#0.75. Two each #1 to #4 with an optional #5 to protect the last few feet past the roof. Slings before and under the roof help the rope run smoothly.
content.location: This is the reference climb for the wall.

content.description: Despite a softish and dirty start, this is a pretty fun route. For most folks the crux will likely be the six in section before the roof. However, it is not very off width in character and those with a flexibility and stemming skills will shoot right up the stem box at the bottom.
content.protection: (1) 0.2-0.4, 1, 2 (save tiny pieces for the thin crack left of the six inch section, up high), (2) 0.5, 0.75, 3,  4.  Save a #1 and #2 for above the roof. Optional #6.
content.location: Left of Skin Tight in the Rocky Alcove. Easy to spot as you walk by because of the 6 inch crack below the roof.

climbs.name: Gong Show
climbs.fa: Aaron Miller, Rich Strang, Josh Smith

content.description: Delicate start leads to thin hands to fingers over a small roof next to the big flake.
content.protection: Two or three each from 0.4 to #1. One 0.2 size useful.

climbs.name: Futuristic
climbs.fa: EB Aaron Miller and Fred Berman

content.description: Striking line that starts out fingers to an arching thin hands crack.
content.location: First crack to the left of the unmistakable Holy Grail roof crack.

content.description: Fun climbing with a crux layback start.
content.location: The far right route in the Rocky Alcove. The Rocky Alcove is the first feature in Capulet.

climbs.name: Dizygotic
climbs.fa: Josh Smith, Jason Hallady, Allison Fritz

content.description: This one is twice twins. Climb twin cracks (hands on left) to steep fingers. Shares anchor with crack on left.
content.location: Obvious splitter on the right wall of the Grassy Alcove.

content.description: Chemo was the 7ft albino heavy from the novel Skintight. Thin hands.
content.location: The obvious left corner in the Rocky Alcove. The Rocky Alcove is the first feature in Capulet.

content.description: Fingers to a roof, step right clip anchor under roof.  Shares anchor with Pollux.
content.location: Short, blank wall with two splitters that come together under a roof that has a tree on top. The shared anchor is under the roof.

content.description: An obvious overhanging off width that just begs for your blood.
content.protection: Cupped hands to #5s; vertical to gently overhanging agony. (4) #3, (3) #4, (2) #5. Save a #3 for the very top.

pathTokens: Capulin Canyon and Cochiti Mesa Area Crags

content.description:
The Capulet side canyon sees a little more shade than the main canyon. None of the routes in the side canyon are more than 100 feet.

 The side canyon routes don't see nearly as much traffic as the upper and main wall routes. Expect loose rock and some dirt.
